table.summary: Table containing one link on each row

tr.td: IMPORTANT NOTICE: Once you click on any one of the following links, you will leave this website. Please note that we are not responsible for any content posted on these websites or the design of these websites.

a.aria-label: Show All links and Link Categories

td.a: COVID-19 UPDATE: A Video Message From Our CEO

img.br: Please click the link to view a video message from our CEO, Chakesha Webb Scott.
Gov. John Bel Edwards has extended the coronavirus stay-at-home order in Louisiana to April 30, he announced in a press conference today. Therefore, schools will stay closed at least until April 30.

td.a: March 22, 2020 COVID-19 SCHOOL CLOSURE UPDATES (click for details)

img.br: Today, Governor John Bel Edwards issued a statewide Stay at Home Order, effective from 5:00 Monday, March 23, 2020 to April 13, 2020. To keep our employees safe and ward off the spread of the coronavirus (COVID-19), we intend to abide by this order.

td.a: March 22, 2020 Technology Needs & Assistance Line (click for details)

img.br: UPDATE—Governor John Bel Edwards announced all K-12 schools (including Impact Charter) will close March 16 to April 13 out of concern over the rise in coronavirus cases in Louisiana. Updates will be posted here, on our a website, social media sites and Remind.
